MONL.content: monolingualism creates my solitude, my ipseity.
monolingual solipsism never belonging, never property, power of mastery, never pure “ipseity” (hospitality or hostility)
desire is borne by the arrival itself, before ipseity (I-me)

R.content: how can we reconcile the turning unity, autos = ipse, the One, the homogeneity of democracy with its heterogeneity, dissymmetry, disseminating multiplicity

democratic sovereignty replaces theogonic politics with something just as phallocentric, phallo-paterno-filio-fraterno-ipsocentric (ipsocratic, though tautological, because ipseity already implies force)

in The Experience of Freedom, Nancy puts to use Heidegger’s Jemeinigkeit, as singularity of time, each time, as other time, also “ipseity of singularity”; Derrida has concerns this risks saving the “I can” of voluntary-conscious-intentional-deciding-I-myself, while acknowledging that Nancy divides it, ruins it, w/ interval or trace of a spacing [see p. 51]
the unconscious remains the most vital reserve of the self-destructive conservation of the “subject” or of egological ipseity; without autoimmunity, no sadism, masochism, consciousness, death drive
no democracy w/out deconstruction (and reverse): democracy is the autos [ipse] of deconstructive self-delimitation

H.content: I want to be master of my house, ipse, to receive whoever I like there

VM.content: w/out using these terms, Levinas warns against confusing idem (same) w/ ipse (ego), identity w/ ipseity > this happens immediately w/ Greek and German: autos, selbst
preethical, transcendental violence institutes relationship btwn 2 finite ipseities

SW.content: ipse: the power itself, the law, law of father, of son, brother, laws of hospitality (hosti-pet-s, hospes, posis, despotes, utpote, “the mysterious -pse of ipse,” says Benveniste, naively astonished)

HLP.content: classical lying: liar knows the truth, knows he is lying, the self excludes the self-lie (the other is other enough, an enemy to be deceived in his belief)
unless we think the other w/in oneself, an ipseity more originary than ego, a divisible ipseity, oneself as enemy

BSi.content: sovereign: he, himself, ipse; beast: she, tamed (mastered) > suspension of pendulum is double
potsedere (possess), potest, possum (power, “I can”) > ipse (self & power) > Benveniste thinks etymological shift from power (despotēs) to himself (ipse) enfeebles, not Derrida
master-self, sovereignty (positionality of self: thesis), ipsissimus (the absolutely himself)
sovereignty, in minimal, strict sense, always a moment of dictatorship: a performative verdict, a Diktat, has no account to render other than to itself (ipse)
Benveniste: dem-pot(i)-[skr.], “master of house,” power of oneself [ipse as sovereignty]

international rights & crimes against humanity invoke a sovereignty of man himself (ipse, ipsissimus) above/beyond/before Nation-State sovereignty (Schmitt sees this as Entpolitisierung, humanity not a political concept)
for Heidegger, in the questioning essence of man, man comes to himself as “who” not “what” (ipseity [Selbst] before any “I,” individual, we or community)
sovereignty of self-present ipseity, only man can say “I”—autodeictic (Kant, Heidegger, Descartes)
zoos profitable to knowledge and economy [physiocratic theory of economy]
nomos of oikos: taming, training, the domus of the dominus > oikonomia also general condition of ipseity as sovereign mastery over beast
